title: Sex Ed
description: A herpes scare causes Michael to get back in touch with his ex-girlfriends, where he decides to reevaluate those relationships. Meanwhile, Andy tries to teach safe sex to his officemates, but he has a clear ulterior motive.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [driving past a line of Mexican men looking for work] Hola, hola. Necesito une bueno worker. Tu esporte! Come on! [man walks away] Que? QUE?

quotes.speaker: Mexican Man
quotes.text: [speaking Spanish]

quotes.speaker: Mexican Man's Son
quotes.text: We don't go with that man. I've seen several men go with that man and not come back.

quotes.speaker: Mexican Man
quotes.text: [speaking Spanish]

quotes.speaker: Mexican Man's Son
quotes.text: We've lost friends.

quotes.speaker: Mexican Man
quotes.text: [speaking Spanish]

quotes.speaker: Mexican Man's Son
quotes.text: We don't know what he does with them.

quotes.speaker: Mexican Man
quotes.text: [speaking Spanish]

quotes.speaker: Mexican Man's Son
quotes.text: I don't want to talk about it anymore.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I pick up day laborers and tell them they'll get paid at six p.m. At five forty five, a certain INS agent by the name of Mose Schrute throws them in the back of a van, drops them off in the middle of Harrisburg and tells them it's Canada.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: Hola amigo.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hola, tu es une buena worker?

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: Si, yo muy bueno worker.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Y el accento, donde are you from?

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: Scranton, y before that La Philadelphia.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You speak English?

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: Yes, I'm really good at English.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, good. Me too, get in the car.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: [quietly] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [nods to camera]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [seeing the worker Dwight picked up in the parking lot] Who's this guy by our cars?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That is my new maintenance worker, Nate. And you'll be happy to know that he's taking care of that hornet's nest that you've been griping about.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah, I got stung up my dress.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Poor hornet.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [looking outside through the window] I left him all the tools he needs. This is do or die. If he chooses correctly he'll conquer the hornets...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: But if he doesn't?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He'll die.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Uhh, beg your pardon?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: When did the phrase do or die become so corrupted?

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: [picks up blowtorch]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Is that a blow torch?!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No. No no no! [nos coming from all employees]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Interesting choice...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Nate starts walking away from hornet's nest, puts down the blowtorch] Yes!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Very very smart.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, go away. [Kelly nodding]

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: [picks up baseball bat, heads towards hornet's nest]

quotes.speaker: Employees except Dwight
quotes.text: No! No no!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: A bat! Impressive...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh it's stinging him! Ow! Ow! [yelling all around the office]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [walks into the office with a large, fake mustache on] Good morning Erin, any mustaches? I mean messages?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [giggles] Terrific!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There are many reasons a man would wear a fake mustache to work. [spinning in chair] He is a fan of the outrageous. He loves to surprise! He loves... other things as well.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [seeing a large red spot on Michael's lip] God! Wow!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [shying away] Look, [sighs] It's a pimple Phyllis. Avrile Lavigne gets them all the time and she rocks harder than anyone alive.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: That's no pimple Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You mean cancer?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What? No! Wait, no. Definitely not cancer.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's just good to stop a Michael train of thought early before it derails and destroys the entire town.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait. It's just a cold sore.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Yup, just a cold sore.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just a cold sore, thank you. Phyllis, I don't have acne. I have a cold sore. I don't even have a cold. I don't know how I got it.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I know how you got it. [smug expression on his face]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Michael come on. A cold sore is herpes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wait! What you should do, Michael, is have a doctor take a look at it. Because we really don't know what that is.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I know tons and tons of people who have herpes. I have it myself. That's what it is.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I never seen herpes on you.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Because it's on my genitals, genius.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You have a penis?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Michael, have you ever been tested for STDs?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah! My last physical when I was forty.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That was like, ten years ago.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No! It was like four years ago!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Michael, you're at least forty six!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why at least? If you're guessing forty six just say forty six. [later in his office, places a band-aid over his cold sore]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Can we please talk about how gross Meredith is?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: This is what you get when you treat your body like an outhouse.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You know what guys, why don't we just chill out on this herp-chat. Ok? I was an REA in college and I can tell you, number one sexually transmitted disease is ignorance.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I guess maybe you should go marry a meth dealer with crabs.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I don't even wanna know these things!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [walking in] Hey guys! [Angela leaves the table, exhales as she exits the room]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How did this happen, how did I get this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Some eggs can rely dormant in a woman for years, they may not even know they have it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what, I feel like one of those old timey sailors. With the eye patch. [in pirate voice] It's me own damn fault. Woman in every port.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What port? The Jan port. The Holly Por...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don't even! Holly was clean! Okay? If anything I gave it to her.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You may have...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh my God! What if I did?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You need to contact Holly! You need to notify her, that she is crawling with herpes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay! You know what? Might! Might be crawling with herpes. I might have gotten it after her.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You need to contact every woman you've been with, and notify them of your herpes infestation. It's the right thing to do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There's no way I'm gonna do that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Then I will.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [makes grunt in attempt to stop Dwight. Dwight hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, I'm no doctor, but it seems to me that we all have an obligation to the public health to track down anyone who gives us a disease, inform them of it, and take overwhelming revenge on that person. Again, I'm no doctor. I'm just a normal guy who enjoys revenge.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: [on phone] Hello?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi Donna. It's Michael.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Michael, I didn't think I'd here from you. How have you been?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have a disease, for which there is no known cure, that has been sexually transmitted to me.

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Oh no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can't even say it. H-I...

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ...R-P-E-E-S

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Wait, you're calling to tell me that you have herpes?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I am calling to see if you gave me herpes. Because if you did I would be able to avoid a lot of sucky conversations. So you have it right?

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: Ummm, no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Does your stupid husband have it?

quotes.speaker: Donna
quotes.text: No! He doesn't. Are you telling me I have to get tested?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes I am telling you you have to get tested for herpes. Good-bye!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So long Donna! [Michael hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Excuse me everyone, can I have your attention please?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Not again...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What do you mean again?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: You're always asking for our attention.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Maybe like a year ago...

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Seems recent.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, that's...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Andy, the reason it seems more recent is because many of us here have never stood up and asked for everyone's attention, and it seems like you've done it on several occasions.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Everyone, I've noticed that we have not been entirely kind to one of our own, due to stigmas and prejudices.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh! When you got your new phone, that's when you asked for everyone's attention.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [agreement around the office] That's what I was thinking, you kept announcing scores.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's the world's only international sport! [sits down]

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: [on phone] This is Holly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No this is Holly.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: No this is Holly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No this is Holly.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: No, this is Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Busted. So what can I do for you Holly.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I am calling because, there's a terrible crash!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh really? Was anyone killed?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: A lot of people.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Any nuns?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Three nuns, [Michael laughs] from a Missionary in South Africa.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Dwight looks confused to the camera] Were they in the missionary position? [Holly laughs]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [singing] Ba na na na na. Hot pizza, check it and see. Ba na na na. Got a whole bunch of pepperoni. Ba na na na na. [stops singing] Yeah, now you're looking at me. Anyone who's interested in entering into an honest discussion about the sexual mores and taboos of modern society will be rewarded with a pizza break.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [still on phone with Holly] Do you ever wonder what life would have been like if you hadn't been transferred?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We would have twins. [Dwight points towards the corner of his lip, indicating Michael's "herpes"]

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I don't think we'd have kids.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmhmm!

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: It was just for a few weeks!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mhhmm! We would be married.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: [sternly] Michael, I have been dating A.J. for a year and a half now. You do this you know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do what?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: You romanticize things.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't romanticize th- [Dwight nodding and mouthing 'Yes you do'] No...

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Michael, you cried at that tagline for a movie you made up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He had no arms or legs, he couldn't hear see, or speak... This is how he let a nation.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: You made ourselves to be more than we were.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We were more than we were.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I don't know what you're getting so upset about, we had to break up a long time ago, it was a good memory.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, alright I gotta go.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Michael... [Michael hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [to the camera] He forgot to mention the herpes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It didn't come up organically.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [to a client] ...to accommodate the, uh, suppliers. [Seeing Michael and Dwight] Gentlemen! Nice to see you, it'll be just a moment. If you could show them into Conference Room B. [to client again] The pharmaceutical aspects should be able to...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: How do I do it? Raise my daughter, work as director of office purchasing for this hospital and release an album of Dorris Day covers on my own label? If I knew I'd tell you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's nice to see you doing so well.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Yeah I'm really happy. Me and Astrid against the world. [laughs] We're loving it, yeah. I'm kind of a supermom.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Bringing home the bacon.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Yeah. [singing] Fry it up in a pan. Never never never let you forget... [laughs] I love that commercial.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't understand the reference.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, Michael, it was nice to get your call.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We had to come over right away, it's urgent. Michael has something to tell you. [Michael shushes him]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Are you gonna keep me in suspense? [Michael sighs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [after long wait, to Dwight] Would you excuse us...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok I'm gonna head outta here, I know you have a lot to talk about. Ok, is there a, an operating theater that's open to visitors? Never mind I'll find it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He hasn't changed.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No, so what couldn't wait?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Am I the kind of person to misremember our relationship as more than it ever was?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael Scott, you are here for a post mortem.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You wanna dig into our relationship, go over it, see what killed it. Ok, I'm in.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So, guys. I've been really bothered by the way certain people are getting treated around here, and I just think as an office we're better than that. Ok, now I'm going to show you a picture of genitalia. [grossed our remarks from around the office as Andy holds p a picture of a nude man]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Andy...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What, is it because he's black?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope, it's because it's genitalia.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Perfectly normal genitalia Tuna. Now I'm going to show you another picture of perfectly normal genitalia. [Kevin is grossed out immediately. The office is grossed out]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Am I blocking anybody? Can everybody see?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's normal! Big deal! Yeah sure it has some herpes on it, but you know what? It's just as normal as anyone else's.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No! In the beginning we were not good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, there was a little bit of a learning curve in the conversation department, but between the sheets we were like Jordan and Pippin!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well if there's anything exciting about it it's because we both knew it was wrong!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Because we work together.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No, ok. Imagine there's a princess, who falls for a guy beneath her station, and the queen doesn't like this at all. And the princess knows that the queen doesn't like it so it just makes her wanna do it all the more just to get at the queen!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Am I the princess?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No I'm the princess, and the queen.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sighs] Ok, so I'm the guy at the station.

quotes.speaker: Astrid
quotes.text: Mommy!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Assy! Awwhhh how was school?

quotes.speaker: Astrid
quotes.text: It was cool.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [singing] What did you learn?

quotes.speaker: Astrid
quotes.text: What did I learn?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You might have learned shapes, or blocks, or clocks, or colors. Or you might have learned that we're all, sisters and brothers.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have herpes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I used to think that she was the one. Or at least A the one. And if I called that one so wrong...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Herpes, like all STDS, is a consequence of sex. Can anyone else name any other consequences?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: It feels unbelievable!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [writing on board] Ok I guess I can make a pros column. Feels...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: ...unbelievable.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: The ability to express love physically. It's a magical thing.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Express love, magical.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: It feels amazing!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Umm, ok is that different from feels unbelievable?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Then I will write it down.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: The feeling of pure risk.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I actually had that down in the cons column, but...

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: It's thrilling.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ok, umm. I'll move that. Thrill of risk.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Andy, aren't there also negatives to sex?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes! Thank you! Such as?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Unplanned pregnancy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes, unplanned pregnancy.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Like Jim and Pam, say whaaat?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Just admit that your baby was a mistake.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey! Our baby was not a mistake. She was a surprise.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Good!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I'm sure they don't regret having their child, let's move it to the pros.

quotes.speaker: {Jim} and {Pam}
quotes.text: Thank you!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ok, unplanned pregnancy, going in the pros column.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Next stop is Helene. You're gonna wanna make a left on Willow, which is a little ways away, uh. I'll remind you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know, I don't know if I trust Jan's judgment. She...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jan knows paper.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I'm not talking about paper. Relationships, they have the ability to point out if the man is making a bigger deal out of something that is really there.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait, what Holly said?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, I don't...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Forget it Michael! Today is about herpes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know, I know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Who gave it to you, who has it, and who is going to pay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Got it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: TO answer your question about Jan, no. Jan is insane. Why do you think I got- LEFT, WILLOW NOW!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'M TRYING! GOD!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [walks into park with Dwight] Hi stranger! Long time!

quotes.speaker: Old Woman
quotes.text: Who are you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm Michael. We dated for a while.

quotes.speaker: Old Woman
quotes.text: I don't think so...

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh hey! Dwight, would you take my grandmother for a walk while I talk to Helene?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on old lady. Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Old Woman
quotes.text: What is happening? [Dwight shushes her]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Who can tell me what the safest form of sex is?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Condoms.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Incorrect, the only true form of safe sex, ok? Abstinence.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Ohh. Ok. I didn't realize we were doing trick questions. What's the safest way to go skiing? Don't ski! [office laughs]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I just thought I'd bring it up in case someone in here was practicing abstinence. That's all.  Anybody?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Andy that's way too personal of a question.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well someone could answer if they want to. [looks at Erin hopefully] Ok, in that case I will now show you how to put this condom on... using this pencil. [Stanley laughs]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Why would you choose a pencil Andy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well I'm not gonna use my penis, Oscar! It's not exactly hard right now anyway.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Come on, give it a rest pencil dick.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm doing this for you Meredith!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I didn't want you it!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well did you h- di- GAH! Does no one appreciate what I'm doing right now?! [throws pizza box at painting and leaves]

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: It'll go away in time just don't touch it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did I make more of what we had then what was really there?

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: What did you think we were?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just a quirky indie movie weird sort of thing, breaking all the rules. But had to end, because the summer was over. For you...

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: I think for you to have come here even expecting that we can have a conversation like this show's ho-how self deluded you are! Michael, your memory has failed you greatly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jerk. [walks off]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael! [attempting to get out of the car on the side in which Michael parked too close to a bush. Michael ignores him and walks into a building.]

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: So this is the chef's kitchen, which makes it perfect for real entertainers.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Real entertainers, like Billy Joel.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Carroll, how are you?

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: I'm great! How are you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm great! I saw your-your sign outside. And I decided, I'm going to pull in, and maybe buy a house from her.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: You didn't call my office and ask where I was?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: Because the receptionist told me a man called but he only said he was my ex-lover.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Weird...

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He sounds like a nice guy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I don't know, I mean people were being really mean to Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: This wasn't really about Meredith was it. You and Erin are broken up.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: How is that relevant to anything?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I asked you if it was ok if I asked her out. You said, and I quote, 'My good sir! Nothing would make me happier than to hand you the hand of the hand once in my hand.' I specifically remember it because you said it in such a weird way.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: The only reason I said that is because you asked me so politely! It was very difficult for me to say no.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I'll let this slide, but I expect you to put this whole Erin thing behind you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh wow another living room!

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: It's a family room.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You put the TV here, you put the family over here.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: Michael why are you here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Someone told me that I romanticize relationships

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: You know, we all do that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have herpes.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: What? Did you have that while we were together?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I just found out today. It's, uh, right there.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: Oh! Oh, that's what you're talking about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmhmm, I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: Did the doctor check it out?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm between specialists right now.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: Yes, yes Michael. Actually you do make a bigger deal out of things than you need to. You proposed to me on our fourth date.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well I believe in love at first sight.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: Well so do I, but we didn't love each other at first either. I don't know what you were thinking!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I knew what I was thinking at the time, but right now it just seems ridiculous.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [walking downstairs] Excuse me, someone died in the upstairs bathroom didn't they?

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [Andy walks in Darryl's office] We should schedule meetings, because the days can slip away with chit-chat. Are you crying?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No I'm just sweating.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I don't know who's got you upset but my advice is stop crying.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm not crying I'm just sweating.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Look you need to pick yourself up. Man up, alright? You will win this in the end. It's all about heart, and character. Be your best self.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I have no idea what his problem is, that's just my standard advice. It's good advice right?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: [on answering machine] This is Holly Flax, I can't come to the phone right now but please leave a message after the sound of the tiny truck backing up. [BEEP]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi Holly it's Michael, I just wanted to call and let you know that I was thinking about what you said. It's just. You know?  It's weird. Today I ended up seeing a lot of women that I used to date, and in my mind they were all great. And then when I actually saw them, it was mostly a freak show. And you and me, that must have been a real train wreck. You know what, Holly? You're wrong. You are wrong. I remember every second of us. And talking to them today, I don't feel for them anything like what I feel for you. I didn't joke with any of them, I joked with you. You are the only one who was actually happy to hear from me. And I don't know why you downgraded what we had but I did not make us up. Ok.  Oh, wait, and you should talk to a doctor because you might have herpes. Bye.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What is this about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oscar, we once sucked face in public. As part of an office presentation to destroy the stigma of gay kissing. Do you recall?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You may have given me a sexually transmitted disease.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Herpes duplex.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It was probably just an ingrown mustache hair but we have to be exhaustive.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have already contacted all of my ex-lovers except for you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: We were never lovers!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm gonna need a list of every man you've ever had sex with. I'm talking train stations, men's rooms...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Flower shops, fireworks celebrations...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Fence with a hole in it..

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Moolit Gandala, carrage drive through Central Park...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The woods behind the liquor store, the swamp behind the old folk's home.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: An electric car dealership. [Oscar gets up and starts leaving]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The democratic primaries,

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oscar! Think abou- Think! [door slams]
